comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: March 17, 1914. Pleasant spring weather brought out a mighty throng of spectators, according to a report next day in The New York Times. The parade, scheduled for two p.m., started an hour late and ran for a full two hours. The mayor and the cardinal kept their seats during the entire time. The reviewing stand, of course, was in front of St. Patrick's Cathedral. New York Times story, March 18, 1914: query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=9806E3DC163AE6...
